Legal_Issue: Whether the risk faced by applicants was generalized or specific
Evidence_Type: Testimony, incident of mistaken identity killing, gang targeting
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by Mara 13 gang in El Salvador
Evaluation_Standard: Risk different in degree from that faced by general population
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Specific targeting by gang after reporting theft to police
Application_Error: Misclassification of risk as generalized despite evidence of specific targeting
Evidence_Ignored: Link between reporting theft, gang threats, and killing of another man due to mistaken identity
Legal_Standard: Section 97 IRPA – risk must be more than generalized danger
Application_Factor: History of gang retaliation following interaction with authorities
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the Board’s finding of generalized risk reasonable?
Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by a different Board member
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider specific evidence of targeting
Procedural_Fairness: Error in assessment leading to unfair determination
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on misapplication of legal standard
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal Court review of refugee determination
Procedural_Issue: Remand due to incorrect legal characterization
Omission_Type: Failure to recognize specific risk despite credible evidence
